intro: Epicampes kunthiana, commonly known as the desert morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its trumpet-shaped flowers and climbing growth habit. The plant produces showy, violet to purple flowers that bloom in the early morning, hence its common name. It has adapted to harsh desert conditions with thick, waxy leaves and deep root systems for water storage. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for xeriscaping in dry climates.
